policy_statement.purpose: To establish standards for identifying and remediating source code vulnerabilities through static analysis.
policy_statement.description: This policy defines requirements for SAST implementation, vulnerability management, and secure code development practices across the organization.
policy_statement.applicability: All development teams and applications that contain custom source code, including micro‑services, libraries, and scripts.
policy_statement.enforcement: Mandatory SAST scans must be integrated into every CI/CD pipeline with defined quality gates; builds failing the gate are blocked from promotion.
policy_statement.exceptions: Legacy applications may request temporary exemptions through the Security Review Board, subject to a documented risk acceptance and remediation timeline.

executive_summary: The organization adopts a risk‑based SAST program aligned with NIST CSF and ISO 27001 to continuously detect code‑level weaknesses. Current findings are limited to a single low‑severity issue, indicating an overall healthy code security posture while highlighting the need for ongoing review of unknown findings.
scope: Application source code security analysis for all in‑house developed software components.
objectives: Integrate automated static analysis into every code commit and build process.
Ensure identified vulnerabilities are triaged, prioritized, and remediated within defined timeframes.
Maintain compliance with NIST CSF Protect function and ISO 27001 A.14 System Development lifecycle controls.

risk_assessment.business_impact: A low‑severity, unknown vulnerability could lead to minor information disclosure if left unaddressed, but the impact on core business operations is limited.

security_controls.title: Input Validation Framework
security_controls.description: Implement a centralized input validation library that enforces whitelist‑based checks for all external data.
implementation_steps: Select a vetted validation library (e.g., OWASP ESAPI).
Integrate the library into all new code modules.
Refactor existing modules to use the library within 90 days.
Document validation rules per data source in the code repository.

security_controls.title: Automated SAST Integration
security_controls.description: Configure CI/CD pipelines to run approved SAST tools on every pull request and nightly builds.
implementation_steps: Deploy SAST tool (e.g., SonarQube, Checkmarx) on the build server.
Create pipeline step that fails the build if findings exceed the defined threshold.
Generate a SARIF report and store it in the artifact repository.
Notify the development team via Slack/Email on each scan result.

security_controls.title: Vulnerability Triage and Response Process
security_controls.description: Establish a formal process to triage SAST findings, assign remediation owners, and track closure.
implementation_steps: Log each finding in the ticketing system with severity tags.
Assign tickets to the responsible component owner within 1 business day.
Review tickets in weekly security stand‑ups.
Close tickets only after successful re‑scan and peer review.

remediation_actions.title: Review and fix unknown security report analysis finding
remediation_actions.success_criteria: The unknown finding is either resolved or documented with a risk acceptance; subsequent SAST scan shows no recurrence of the same issue.

monitoring_requirements: Automated SAST scans on every code commit (CI) and nightly full scans (CD).
Weekly reporting of new findings to the Security Steering Committee.
Quarterly security code reviews by peer developers and the Application Security Team.
review_schedule: Quarterly policy review and annual audit
